summary: This is an email chain from January 26, 2021, discussing whether FBI agents in the New York Field Office had obtained jail calls or emails for Ghislaine Maxwell directly from the Bureau of Prisons (BOP). The correspondence clarifies that no such calls were obtained due to the lack of a subpoena, and it includes a procedural note about obtaining inmate communications via BOP Intelligence Officers embedded at the Joint Terrorism Task Force (JTTF).

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the email inquiry, specifically whether jail calls or emails for her had been obtained by the FBI from the Bureau of Prisons.

events.title: Email inquiry about Maxwell's BOP communications
events.description: An email chain within the FBI New York Field Office and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York confirms that jail calls and emails for Ghislaine Maxwell had not been obtained from the Bureau of Prisons, as no subpoena was in place.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: As of January 26, 2021, the FBI New York Field Office had not obtained jail calls or emails for Ghislaine Maxwell directly from the Bureau of Prisons.
The lack of a subpoena was cited as the reason for not requesting or receiving these communications.
The email references a process where FBI agents can obtain BOP inmate calls and emails directly from a BOP Intelligence Officer embedded at the Joint Terrorism Task Force (JTTF).
A note cautions that emails obtained via this BOP process may not have had attorney-client communications screened out.
The correspondence is between personnel at the FBI New York Field Office (Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking) and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
